meanings.def: a flying vehicle with wings and one or more engines
examples: a passenger/fighter/military/private plane
They boarded the plane and flew to Chicago.
I caught the next plane to Dublin.
The plane took off an hour late.
The plane landed in Geneva.
to fly a plane
by plane She left by plane for Berlin.
a plane ticket
a plane crash
a plane ride/flight/journey
She likes plain food, without sauces or cheese.
Wheat is still grown on the Lombardy plain.
They recently flew into London on a private plane.
You may need to plane the surface for a smoother fit.
I've never flown in a plane.
She caught the first plane out.
The Soviets shot down our U-2 spy plane.
The plane was carrying 350 people.
The plane was cruising at 20 000 feet.
The president was never on the plane at all.
We left by plane for Beijing.
a military cargo plane
the first generation of passenger planes, like the Boeing 707

meanings.def: any flat or level surface, or an imaginary flat surface through or joining material objects
examples: the horizontal/vertical plane
We may describe uniquely any point in a plane by an ordered pair of numbers, called coordinates.

meanings.def: a level of thought, existence or development
examples: With practice, an athlete can reach a higher plane of achievement.
They seem to exist on a different spiritual plane.
Like all talented musicians, he operates on a different plane from most people.

meanings.def: a tool with a blade (= sharp metal part) set in a flat surface, used for making the surface of wood smooth by cutting very thin layers off it

examples: a plane surface

meanings.def: to make a piece of wood smoother or flatter with a plane
examples: plane something Plane the surface down first.
plane something + adj. Then plane the wood smooth.
She likes plain food, without sauces or cheese.
Wheat is still grown on the Lombardy plain.
They recently flew into London on a private plane.
You may need to plane the surface for a smoother fit.

meanings.def: to fly without moving the wings, especially high up in the air
to move quickly across water, only just touching the surface
examples: The boat planed past in clouds of spray.
